gurmukhi: DuxM Fol b`jy ] mhwN sUr g`jy ]
transliteration: Dhounan Dhol Bajje|| Mahaan Soor Gadje||
translation: Listening to the resounding voice of the drums, the warriors thunder.

gurmukhi: kry ssqR GwvM ] cVHy ic`qy cwvM ]6]
transliteration: Dare Sastra Ghaavan|| Chadhe Chitt Chaavan||6||
translation: They inflict wounds with weapons, their minds filled with great zest.6.
Fearlessly, they cause their horses to run and strike the blows of axes.

gurmukhi: kry qyg GwXM ] cqHy ic`q cwXM ]7]
transliteration: Dare Teg Ghaayan|| Chadhe Chitt Chaayan||7||
translation: Many inflict wounds with their swords and the minds of all are very enthusiastic.7.

gurmukhi: bkY mwr mwrM ] n sMkw ibcwrM ]
transliteration: Bakai Maar Maaran|| Na Sankaa Bichaaran||
translation: From their mouths, they shout “kill, kill”, without any doubts.

gurmukhi: rulY q`C mu`CM ] krY surg ie`CM ]8]
transliteration: Rulai Tachchh Mouchchhan|| Darai Surag Ichchhan||8||
translation: The chopped warriors are rolling in dust and wish to go to heaven.8.

gurmukhi: nYk n rn qy muir clYN krY infr hÍY Gwie ]
transliteration: Naik Na Ran Te Mur(i) Chalain Darai Nidar Hvai Ghaae||
translation: They do not retrace their steps from the battlefield and inflict wounds fearlessly.

gurmukhi: igr igr prY pvMg qy bryN brMgn jwie ]9]
transliteration: Gir Gir Darai Pavan Te Daren Baranad Jaae||9||
translation: Those who fall from their horses, the heavenly damsels go to wed them.9.

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD hoq BXo sMgRwmw ] jUJy cMd nrwien nwmw ]
transliteration: Ih Bidh(i0 Hot Bhayo Sanraamaa|| Joojhe Channd Naraain Naamaa||
translation: In this way, the battle continued on both sides (with great vigour). Chandan Rai was killed.

gurmukhi: qb juJwr eykl hI DXo ] bIrn Gor dso ids lXo ]10]
transliteration: Tah Jujhaar Ekal Hoo Dhayo|| Booran Gher Daso Dis Layo||10||
translation: Then Jajhar Singh continued the fight quite alone. He was surrounded from all the sides.10.

gurmukhi: DisXo ktk mY Jtk dY kCU n sMk ibcwr ]
transliteration: Dhasiyo Katak Mai Jhatak Dai Kachhodh Na Sank Bichaar||
translation: He rushed into the army of the enemy without any hesitation.
